title.narrative: COMMUNICATIONS, ADVOCACY AND PARTNERSHIPS

description.narrative: Right of children to information and expression is progressively fulfilled and stakeholder and duty bears are increasingly aware of the situation of children and women, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is effectively designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Right of children to information and expression is progressively fulfilled and stakeholder and duty bears are increasingly aware ofthe situation of children and women

description.narrative: Since 2019 UNICEF has worked to bring attention to children’s rights in Burundi through traditional and digital media. Partnerships with local media enabled UNICEF to produce and disseminate messages on hygiene promotion, education, COVID-19, climate change, children rights and youth participation. UNICEF continued to publish diverse content and stories via the website and social media, audiences have considerably increased on Facebook,;Instagram, Twitter from;2020 to 2021.;with a major focus on COVID-19 prevention and information, enabling a better understanding of the UNICEF mandate and advocacy messages by the public and the opinion-makers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2021

title.narrative: of initiatives for redynamisation the Burundi National Children Forum, Number

target.value: 2023:4 HIS, 10 videos, 3 campagnes photo, 1 icon story and 1 annual calendar

actual.value: 2021:37 HIS, 11 videos, 3 campagnes photo, 0 icon story and 1 annual calendar

title.narrative: of broadcasts, articles, radio programs and blogs or social media contents produced by children / on children's rights, Number

baseline.value: 33,966 Facebook likes, 1,299 followers on Instagram and 67,444 vues on YouTube

target.value: 2023:46,466 Facebook likes, 5000 followers on Instagram and 75,000 vues on YouTube

actual.value: 2021:69,517 total Facebook followers,9936 followers on Instagram, 2608 followers on Twitter, 104.2K vues on YouTube
